Description: Most days of the week, you feel depressed most of the time.
Symptoms3: Trouble to get sleep or feeling sleepy all the time
Symptoms4: Feeling restless, tired, worthless, or guilty

Description: You will feel nervous and restless most of the time.
Symptoms1: Trouble concentrating caused by the fear
Symptoms4: Having a sense of impending danger, panic or doom

Description: You feel extremely sad and lose interest in activities you used to enjoy.Even when good things happen, you feel bad, especially during the morning.
Most of the time you will feel uneasy.
Symptoms4: Walking up and down the room

Description: Having depression lasts for 2 years or longer.
Symptoms1: Sleeping too much or too little
Symptoms2: Appetite change as weight keep changing

Description: Mood episodes range from extremely high energy with high moods to low depressed periods.
Most often happens during the winter months, when the days grow short and you get less and less sunlight.
Hallucinations (seeing or hearing things that aren't there)
Symptoms2: Paranoia (falsely thinking that other people are trying to hurt you)
Symptoms3: Psychomotor agitation(not being able to relax)

Description: Peripartum depression may exist in women who experience significant depressive episodes in the weeks and months following giving birth. In the peripartum period, about 1 in 10 men also experience depression.
When their period first starts, women with PMDD experience depression and other symptoms.
Symptoms1: Loss of interest in activities once enjoyed

Description: When you're struggling to control a stressful situation in your life, you may feel depressed.
Symptoms2: Lack of enjoyment in normal activities

Description: This sort of depression is distinct from the enduring melancholy of ordinary depression. It's regarded as a specifier that characterises a constellation of depressed symptoms. If you suffer from atypical depression, a happy occasion may momentarily lift your spirits.
Symptoms2: Feeling of heaviness in your arms and legs
